DataElement.preferredName: Participant Authorization Collection And Storage Blood And Tissue 5 Year Future Malignant Neoplasm Research Activity Consent Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response to a question that asks is the participant has given permission to collect and store blood and tissue samples for up to 5 years for future cancer research.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Authorization Collection And Storage Blood And Tissue Integer::5 Year Future Malignant Neoplasm Research Activity Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity._Decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::5_The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days._A time that is yet to come._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004_Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered._Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A time that is yet to come.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Participant has given permiss
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to collect and store blood and tissue for at least 5 years for future use in research to learn about, prevent, treat, or cure cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to collect and store blood and/or tissue for future use in research to learn about, prevent, treat, or cure cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission have blood, tissue, and stool specimens collected for future research described in the protocol and consent form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to keep samples for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer and other health problems

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to keep samples for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer and other health problems

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient agrees to allow blood and tissue samples to be collected and used for future extended research, as described in the patient information and consent sheet.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to collect and store blood for future use in research to learn about, prevent, treat, or cure cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to collect and store blood, urine, and/or tissue specimens and related information in a Biobank or future use in research to learn about, prevent, treat, or cure cancer and other health problems.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to allow the tumor sample that was removed during image-guided biopsy, the tumor sample from breast surgery, and related information to be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research?
